images.copyright: Pont d’Arcole on the Seine river, Paris, France (© StockByM/Getty Images)
images.title: Spanning the Seine
images.caption: Pont d'Arcole over the Seine river, Paris, France
images.desc: Welcome to Paris, France’s ancient capital city, through which flows one of the country’s longest rivers, the Seine. Human habitation here dates back to at least the 3rd century BCE, when a Gallic tribe called the Parisii settled on an island in the middle of the river. Today, that island is known as the Île de la Cité, seen on the left of our photo, and is home to Notre-Dame cathedral, as well as other striking buildings such as the medieval Conciergerie, pictured here.
